title: CLI Integration Specification
description:
Document exact bd and gt commands to wrap and their usage patterns.

### bd Commands to Document
- Issue management (create, update, close, list, query)
- Dependencies (dep add, dep list)
- Labels (label add, label remove)
- SQL access (sql)
- Git operations (hooks, worktree)
- Molecules (mol pour, mol wisp)

### gt Commands to Document
- Status and health
- Mail system
- Convoy management
- Agent operations
- Rig management

### Acceptance Criteria
- Command reference for all wrapped commands
- Input validation rules
- Output parsing patterns
- Error handling for each command
- Timeout and retry policies

### References
- ./references/gastown-webuis.md
- ./references/borrowable-components.md
close_reason: Created comprehensive spec/cli-integration.md covering: bd commands (create, update, close, list, query, dep, label, sql, hooks, worktree, mol), gt commands (status, doctor, mail, convoy, sling, polecat, rig), input validation, output parsing, error handling, timeout/retry policies, and WebUI integration patterns

title: Feature Prioritization Matrix
description:
Define which features belong in MVP vs later phases. Analyze all features from existing tools, categorize by complexity/value, and create prioritized feature list.

### Acceptance Criteria
- All features from existing tools catalogued
- Priority assigned (MVP, Phase 2-5, Future)
- Complexity estimates for each feature
- Dependencies between features identified

### References
- ./references/feature-matrix.md
- ./references/requirements.md
close_reason: Feature Prioritization Matrix completed. Document created at ./prds/feature-prioritization-matrix.md with 63 features across 5 phases, complexity/value scoring, dependencies, and risk assessment.

title: Component Wireframes
description:
Design UI structure and navigation for all major views.

### Views to Wireframe
- Main layout and navigation
- Issue list view
- Kanban board
- Epics view
- Metrics dashboard
- Gantt chart
- Terminal drawer
- Verification queue
- Settings/configuration

### Acceptance Criteria
- Low-fidelity wireframes for all views
- Navigation flow documented
- Responsive breakpoints defined
- Accessibility considerations noted

### References
- ./references/feature-matrix.md
- ./references/borrowable-components.md
close_reason: Created comprehensive spec/wireframes.md with ASCII wireframes for: Main Layout, Navigation (expanded/collapsed), Issue List View (rows, states, creation modal), Kanban Board (cards, swimlanes, drag-drop), Epics View (list, detail, progress), Metrics Dashboard (CFD, lead time, aging WIP, health indicators), Gantt Chart (timeline, interactions), Terminal Drawer (tabs, agent sessions), Verification Queue (ReTake dialog), Settings (tabs, keyboard shortcuts). Also includes responsive breakpoints (xs/sm/md/lg/xl), accessibility considerations (WCAG 2.1 AA, keyboard nav, screen reader), and navigation flows

title: Unified Beads WebUI Planning
description: Epic for all planning activities related to the Unified Beads WebUI project. This encompasses feature prioritization, architecture decisions, data flow design, component wireframes, API contracts, and CLI integration specs.
close_reason: All 6 planning epics completed: (1) Feature Prioritization Matrix - 63 features across 5 phases, (2) Architecture Decision Records - 7 ADRs (runtime, framework, state, data access, realtime, components), (3) Data Flow Diagrams - system architecture, read/write paths, WebSocket lifecycle, (4) CLI Integration Specification - bd and gt commands with validation/parsing/retry policies, (5) API Contract Definition - REST endpoints, WebSocket events, TypeScript types, (6) Component Wireframes - 10 views with responsive breakpoints and accessibility. Full planning documentation in ./

title: Data Flow Diagrams
description:
Document how data moves between CLI, database, and UI components.

### Diagrams to Create
- Overall system architecture
- Read path (SQLite/Dolt → UI)
- Write path (UI → CLI → Database)
- Real-time sync flow (file watcher → WebSocket → UI)
- CLI execution flow (ProcessSupervisor)

### Acceptance Criteria
- All major data flows documented
- Sequence diagrams for key operations
- Error handling paths identified
- Performance considerations noted

### References
- ./spec/index.md
- ./references/beads-schema.md
close_reason: Created comprehensive spec/data-flow.md with all required diagrams: overall architecture, read/write paths, real-time sync, CLI execution flow, error handling, and performance considerations

title: Architecture Decision Records
description:
Document formal tech stack choices and architectural decisions with rationale.

### Decisions to Document
- Runtime selection (Bun vs Node.js)
- Frontend framework (SvelteKit vs Next.js)
- State management approach
- Database access strategy (direct vs CLI)
- Real-time communication pattern
- Component library approach

### Acceptance Criteria
- ADR for each major decision
- Alternatives evaluated
- Trade-offs documented
- Team consensus recorded

### References
- ./references/tech-stack-analysis.md
close_reason: Architecture Decision Records completed. Created 6 ADRs covering: Runtime (Bun), Frontend (SvelteKit), State (Svelte stores), Data access (CLI writes/SQL reads), Real-time (file watching + WebSocket), and Components (gastown_ui). All ADRs in proposed status pending team review.

title: API Contract Definition
description:
Define the internal API between frontend and backend.

### Endpoints to Define
- Issues CRUD (/api/issues/*)
- Metrics (/api/metrics/*)
- Git operations (/api/git/*)
- Agent operations (/api/agent/*)
- WebSocket events

### Acceptance Criteria
- OpenAPI/Swagger spec for REST endpoints
- WebSocket event schema
- Request/response types (TypeScript)
- Error response format
- Authentication/authorization model

### References
- ./spec/index.md
close_reason: Created comprehensive spec/api-contract.md covering: REST endpoints (Issues CRUD, Dependencies, Metrics CFD/LeadTime/Throughput/AgingWIP/Health, Git worktrees/PRs/CI, Agent status/polecats/convoys), WebSocket events with full protocol, TypeScript types, error format, auth model, pagination, rate limiting, and OpenAPI reference
